channel.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: 'Media gimmick': Israel condemns Greta Thunberg’s humanitarian yacht heading Gaza; calls it a ‘selfie yacht’
item.description: Israel's foreign ministry has denounced the Gaza-bound ships, including one carrying Greta Thunberg, as a publicity stunt rather than genuine humanitarian aid. The ministry insists that the maritime zone off Gaza is legally blockaded and that aid is already being delivered through official channels.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Elon Musk hit Scott Bessent? White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt dismisses report; calls it 'robust disagreements'
item.description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt downplayed reports of a physical altercation between Elon Musk and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, referring to it as a "robust disagreement." The incident allegedly occurred after Bessent accused Musk of fraudulent behavior, escalating into a physical confrontation, according to Steve Bannon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Colombia Presidential candidate shot in head: Miguel Uribe undergoes successful initial surgery; condition 'grave', say medics
item.description: Colombian presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe is in critical condition after being shot at a Bogota rally, prompting national outrage and candlelight vigils. The 39-year-old senator underwent urgent surgery, with his family requesting prayers as authorities investigate the attack's motive. Politicians across the spectrum condemned the violence, while international figures like Marco Rubio criticized the political climate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: LA riots: 'They spit, we hit,' says Donald Trump; directs officials to 'liberate city from migrant invasion'
item.description: President Trump has authorized the deployment of National Guard troops to Los Angeles amidst protests against immigration raids, citing concerns over law and order. He justified the move by alleging demonstrators engaged in violence against federal agents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Ensures financial independence’: Vietnam bride gets unusual dowry; gift includes 100 civet cats
item.description: A Vietnamese bride received an extraordinary dowry, including 100 civet cats valued at $70,000, alongside gold, cash, shares, and properties. Her father aims to ensure her financial independence, empowering her to manage these income-generating assets. The groom's family reciprocated with gold, cash, and diamond ornaments, reflecting the cultural significance of dowries in Asian societies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who was Issac Paul Olakkengil, the Indian engineer who died in scuba diving incident in Dubai
item.description: Issac Paul Olakkengil, a 29-year-old civil engineer, tragically passed away from cardiac arrest during a scuba diving training session in Dubai. He was on vacation with his wife and brother, both engineers, when the incident occurred at Jumeirah Beach. Dubai police have launched an investigation, and the Indian community mourns the loss of the respected professional.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Active situation': Plane crashes in Tennessee with at least 16 onboard; several airlifted to hospitals
item.description: A plane carrying between 16 and 20 people crashed in Coffee County, Tennessee, about 60 miles south of Nashville. Several passengers were airlifted to nearby hospitals, while others are being evaluated at the scene. Initial reports suggest the aircraft was being used for skydiving activities, according to law enforcement officials.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Trump was pissed’: Ted Cruz on Musk's 'venting'; says he ‘felt like kids of divorce wishing mommy and daddy would stop screaming’
item.description: Senator Ted Cruz recounted witnessing Donald Trump's anger as Elon Musk launched a scathing online attack against the former president. Cruz described the situation as painful, feeling like a child caught in a bitter divorce.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Sever relations': Bioterror arrests spark alarm; US CCP expert warns China planning ‘something worse than Covid’
item.description: Amidst arrests of alleged bioterrorists in Michigan, an expert advocates severing ties with China, citing potential threats worse than COVID-19. The case involves Chinese nationals accused of smuggling and researching a harmful fungus, raising concerns about espionage and potential economic disruption through agricultural sabotage. These incidents highlight ongoing security risks and the need for vigilance against foreign threats.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Feud on pause? Aides of Elon Musk and Donald Trump hold talks; but 'relationship remains uncertain': Report
item.description: Aides are in talks to maintain the fragile peace between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, following their social media clash. Despite a temporary halt in public disagreements, tensions remain high, fueled by Musk's criticisms and Trump's anger over Epstein-related claims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Unrest in LA: Trump sends in troops to control immigration protests
item.description: Amid escalating protests against immigration raids in Los Angeles, President Trump deployed National Guard troops, a move Governor Newsom criticized as inflammatory and a misuse of power. The deployment, the first of its kind since 1965, sparked confrontations, with federal officers using tear gas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Journalist under fire: ABC's Terry Moran targets 'hater' Donald Trump, Stephen Miller; Karoline Leavitt demands action for 'rampage'
item.description: Karoline Leavitt criticized ABC News' Terry Moran for deleted social media posts calling Stephen Miller and Donald Trump names. ABC News was contacted for accountability after Moran's remarks, which Vice President JD Vance also condemned. This controversy occurred as Trump deployed National Guard troops to address unrest near Paramount, California, where protests disrupted Border Patrol operations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Royal tradition under pressure: King Charles ‘livid’ as cherished Christmas tradition faces threat- here’s why
item.description: King Charles is reportedly upset due to a pheasant shortage at Sandringham, potentially disrupting the royal family's traditional Boxing Day shoot. His preference for maintaining the estate's natural game population, rather than importing birds, has led to this issue. The situation might prompt a reassessment of the hunting custom and could even create an opportunity for reconciliation with Prince Harry.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No deals for release': Pakistan's ex-PM Imran Khan to be released from jail? What his party leaders said
item.description: Imran Khan is anticipated to secure bail on June 11 in the Al-Qadir Trust case, according to PTI chief Gohar Ali Khan, while the Islamabad High Court is set to hear petitions for Khan and his wife. PTI plans a political movement led by Khan from jail and rejects any deals for his release, despite government offers for talks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nepal’s new NOC rule for UAE travellers: How Indian expats lost Dh1,400 during trip
item.description: Recent changes in Nepal’s travel regulations have caught many Indian expats in the UAE by surprise, leading to unexpected challenges and additional expenses. Travellers are urged to stay informed about the updated requirements to ensure smooth journeys. Experts highlight the importance of preparation to avoid delays and complications when returning to the UAE via Nepal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: WWE in the West Wing: How Elon Musk got beaten up by a gay banker; during Pride Month
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Turn back': Israel orders military to block 'antisemite' Greta Thunberg-led aid boat from reaching Gaza
item.description: Greta Thunberg and other activists are sailing to Gaza with aid, but Israel has vowed to prevent their entry, citing the need to maintain its naval blockade against Hamas. The Freedom Flotilla Coalition's vessel, Madleen, aims to deliver humanitarian assistance and highlight the worsening crisis in the region, despite previous attempts facing setbacks and accusations of Israeli attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It made us all jump': Lightning hits California home as 6-year-old stands nearby; watch
item.description: A Southern California family experienced a terrifying moment when lightning struck a nearby house while they were filming a storm. Tiffanie Buckner was recording the approaching dark clouds when a bolt hit a home in the cul-de-sac, just feet away from her daughter. The loud thunderclap caused the family to scream and run, but thankfully, no one was injured, and the house didn't catch fire.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Great job': Trump hails National Guard for quelling LA protests; bans masks at stirs
item.description: Donald Trump praised the National Guard's role in handling Los Angeles immigration protests, claiming he federalized them due to local authorities' inability to manage the situation. However, mayor Karen Bass refuted the deployment. Trump also declared a ban on masks at protests, questioning protesters' motives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Isolated event': US ambassador dismisses Canadian travel warning, denies widespread phone searches at border
item.description: US Ambassador Pete Hoekstra defends US border practices amid Canadian concerns, dismissing Ottawa's travel warning about potential phone searches and detentions as isolated incidents. Despite reports of increased scrutiny and negative experiences, Hoekstra maintains America is welcoming. Travel between the two countries has declined, with a significant drop in flights and a majority of Canadians feeling unwelcome in the US.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
